bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 104 (Tuesday, June 15, 2021)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. CARTER of Georgia:H.R. 3896.=========================== NOTE ===========================June 15, 2021, on page H2817, in the Constitutional AuthorityStatement section in the left-hand column, the following appeared:By Mr CARTER of Georgia: H.R. 8896.The online version has been corrected to read: By Mr CARTER ofGeorgia: H.R. 3896.========================= END NOTE =========================Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:The constitutional authority on which this bill rests isthe power of Congress to make rules for the government andregulation of the land and naval forces, as enumerated inArticle I; Section 8, Clause 14 of the United StatesConstitution.[Page H2817]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.

bill.title: To direct the Secretary of Defense to submit to Congress a report on congressional increases to the budget of the Department of Defense for fiscal year 2023, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
